p: Medicinal plants have broad antimicrobial properties against important fish pathogens. Further studies on chronic and acute toxicity and on the deleterious effects of herbal medicines on treated organisms, non-target organisms, and the environment are encouraged. Most studies on effectiveness have been based on in vitro testing or even conducted under laboratory conditions. Therefore, further practical and economic studies are needed to enable replacement of the current treatments. Joint work between the supply chain, industry, and researchers are paramount to studying medicinal plants that may present antimicrobial effects against important fish pathogens.
